SEO Specialist

Company Name affix Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 42 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

I am guessing that, if you’re reading this, there is a pretty good chance you know what to expect from this gig, what needs doing and, at the very least, what the hell good SEO is.
\xa0
Let’s all assume you pass that test and I can talk more broadly as to what this is – what it means for you and, perhaps, why you should be interested. I’ll rattle off some specific stuff too, but I don’t want to hit you with “death by bullet point” and a boring copy+paste job spec.
\xa0
Agency side. Think of this as a well-funded start-up. This is a business that has been proactive on re-positiong and going through a re-brand. \xa0Why? Well, to stay relevant and to set the foundations for them to continue to grow and scale.
\xa0
The restructure has moved them into a genuine agile environment and who are they? A business where creative meets data and their sweet spot covers both strategy and execution, more so the former – in my view.
\xa0
As the business continues to grow in the way they are, you’ll have support – get the direction you need and only when you need it, scope and autonomy to test, fail, learn. Cover off skill gaps to help you to grow and to further support the business. This is a very good business and culture to support learning and development and progression.
\xa0
Down to the detail, we need a few things – but I’m not going to rattle them all off on here. We can talk about that if this grabs you. You’ll need to lend your expertise across a wide range of Campaign work, content, reporting/tracking and Google, Google, Google.
\xa0
I’ll leave it at that, but if this interests you or excites you so much that you can’t sleep at night? Well, apply and talk to us so we can talk about all of the things.
\xa0
Sara Bienias

sara.bienias@affix.com.au

Company Name Open Universities Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 10 views

Job description

We currently have a fantastic opportunity for a senior SEM Specialist to join OUA.

This is a pivotal role which will see you work with the wider Digital and Marketing team to develop and deliver successful SEM campaigns. The scope of the role will see you:


  • Develop Paid Search strategies
  • Oversee campaign budgets
  • Drive customer acquisition through SEM
  • Use bid management tools
  • Manage post campaign analytics and insights
  • Maximise the performance of SEM campaigns
  • Monitor industry trends to improve customer journey across the organisation.

To succeed in this role, you will demonstrate:


  • At least 3 years experience working with SEM
  • A proven track record in developing and executive successful SEM Strategies
  • Exposure to all aspects of SEM campaigns including creating concepts, overseeing campaign budgets, using bid management tools and managing post-campaign analytics
  • Proven track record of generating sales through SEM campaigns
  • Experience increasing ROI on PPC campaigns
  • Experience with Google Analytics
  • Third party platform experience
  • Up-to-date understanding of the latest trends in SEM
  • Experience in the Education field would be highly regarded

To fit in with our team, you enjoy working collaboratively, are highly motivated to achieve, exhibit high levels of communication and interpersonal skills, excellent problem solving, reporting and analytical capabilities.

What is in it for you?

  • Opportunity to join a growth organisation with a social purpose - where online education is truly transforming student’s lives.
  • Fantastic and supportive culture
  • Great Location - Melbourne CBD based (Right next to Southern Cross station).
  • Generous Study Assistance policy.
  • Salary packaging benefits.
  • Opportunities to further grow and progress your career.

\xa0

To find out more about Open Universities Australia (OUA), please visit our website https://www.open.edu.au.

\xa0

If this piques your interest, please click Apply now\xa0to submit your application or send in an enquiry about the role.

\xa0

Candidates need to hold working rights in order to apply. Please note that we are not accepting third party applications currently.

836019355:
[

Senior Manager Industry Events & Customer Engagement

Company Name Australia Post Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 75 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Australia Post is changing at an incredible pace. In the Business and Government department, we’ve integrated technological services that help large organisations and government departments adapt in an increasingly digital world without relegating on our historically successful offering of parcels and mail - all of which helps move Australia forward.

And we’re only getting started.


Nowadays, our plans are to lead the enterprise, business and government service space by encompassing our full range of products. And to get there, we’re on the lookout for ambitious people to join our truly diverse team. Working within a start-up culture that’s backed by all the resources Australia Post provides, the opportunity to innovate and push boundaries to improve services for all Australians is ready and waiting.


What it's like to work here:


For you, it means you'll do great work, learn from the best and develop a career within a robust and well-invested but empowering and creative environment. We all work hard – we're working on major challenges, after all – but we also recognise that you have a life outside of the office, so we provide flexible conditions that enable you to grow whilst enjoying genuine work life balance.


What does the role involve?

Reporting into the Customer & Industry Engagement Lead, The Senior Manager, Industry Events & Customer Engagement will be responsible for leading a range of critical proactive stakeholder and industry engagement initiatives and events in support of our Business & Government Segment’s strategic growth initiatives. This will include everything from the identification and creation of platforms with industry partners, designing and executing\xa0

events, creating programs for existing customers and identifying new opportunities for growth.


  • Support the Customer & Industry Engagement Lead \xa0in the development and implementation of an integrated marketplace engagement plan in support of Australia Posts’ growth strategy and revenue aspirations
  • Design, manage and execute a variety of events and conferences aimed at industry partners and customers
  • Strategic advice to support sales activity and identify industry and stakeholder alignment (in consultation with Enterprise teams engaging with industry)
  • Develop messages and corporate narrative to successfully influence key industry stakeholders and regulators
  • Working with other third party organisations and associations to build support for our strategic growth initiatives.
  • Partner with Communications, Government Relations, Strategy teams, Sales GMs, Product GM’s and EGM’s to increase customer advocacy and drive new revenue opportunities.
  • Expand our reach and advocacy by Identifying and managing key strategic sponsorships
  • Leading our proactive engagement with industry bodies and associations to build awareness, confidence and advocacy for Australia Post’s capability as a market leader in the provision of transformational products and services
  • Co-ordinating our engagement with key regulatory bodies across a range of industries to ensure we have the appropriate awareness to support our capability offering

\xa0

What experience will you have?


We are looking for candidates with experience across Event Delivery, Project Management & B2B Marketing. You will need to have top notch stakeholder engagement capability with a solid understanding of customer segmentation.


  • Experience in leveraging customer insights to contribute to the development of tailored, innovative and differentiated customer solutions
  • Strong experience in event delivery and project management
  • Strong commercial acumen, creativity and initiative
  • Experience in working with multiple agency suppliers
  • Proven experience managing relationships with C-suite level stakeholders, customers and partners
  • Demonstrated experience building strong cross functional working relationships within a matrix environment
  • Experience driving initiatives that gain buy-in and sign off from senior stakeholder groups
  • Knowledge of key market drivers and latest developments within competitive markets related to government service

\xa0

Benefits & Culture:

We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in our people. We encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, cultures and disabilities. A career at Australia Post Group can lead down many paths and we are passionate about offering a supportive, inclusive culture, competitive compensation and flexible working conditions that enable you to develop whilst enjoying genuine work life balance.


To register your interest with our passionate careers team, please click 'Apply Now' and please remember to upload your details and your most recent resume.

828334989:
[

Purchasing Officer

Company Name Consortio X Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 140 views

Job description

Located in the south-eastern suburbs of Melbourne, this organisation is becoming a dominant player in the heavy vehicle industry. Due to an increase in orders an opportunity has arisen for a customer focussed purchasing officer to join their team.


The Purchasing Officer will report to the Financial Controller & HR Manager and will be responsible for the purchasing of raw materials to support all scheduling activities for manufacturing.


Responsibilities:

• Procurement of raw materials to support production schedules for mixing and filling.

• Daily check and follow up actions for failed sales, out of stock items, and review of the critical stock report.

• Review and monitor inbound deliveries and provide advice to production stakeholders on current status.

• Manage inventory levels and status to budget requirements

• Improve quality of supply through ‘win-win’ partnership.

• To reduce overall level of raw material inventory

• To raise and expedite all factory purchase orders under the supervision of the Purchasing and Planning Manager.

• Approve payment of invoices for orders received of acceptable quality.

• Provide accurate and reliable information to Management on the total inventory control functions leading to cost/benefit recommendations.

• To ensure that as a result of Audits corrective action is responded to as soon as possible.

• Communicate effectively and work collaboratively with all other departments to ensure all aspects of the manufacturing process run efficiently.

• Work with the Senior Master Scheduler to ensure short and medium-term planning is optimised


Key Requirements:

• Minimum of 2 years’ experience in purchasing of raw materials in the metal manufacturing, ideally in automotive or truck industry

• Knowledge/experience of raw material & components importation

• Experience of dealing with clearing & freight forwarding for sea & air shipment

• Clear communication

• Run MRP to source raw material & components

• Experience of working high volume & large number of raw, components & consumables

• Good communication with a sense of urgency and decisiveness

• Strong ability to manage stakeholders

• Computer Skills (MS Office Suite, Excel, Pronto System)


This is a fantastic opportunity for career driven purchaser who is looking to develop their career in a multinational organisation. \xa0


For further information on this fantastic opportunity to join a leading brand in the industry, hit APPLY to forward a current and relevant CV. Alternatively, please call our office on 03 86395819.

Digital Insights Lead

Company Name Origin Energy Company Location Melbourne, AU

Job description

  • Do you love data, insights and using these to drive and shape the customer journey?
  • Exciting Digital Strategy
  • Central Melbourne CBD location and competitive salary package
  • Application close date: 30th August 2018


Origin - Australia's Leading Integrated Energy Company

An integral part of Australia’s energy future, we explore, produce, generate and sell energy to power millions of Australian homes and businesses every day, keeping them going and growing.

Origin is the largest energy retailer in Australia, and with 4.3 million customers we’re constantly evolving and changing to better suit their needs. Our activities include power generation, energy trading, the sale of LPG, electricity, natural gas and solar as well as the development of new and emerging technologies. Consider your possibilities with Australia’s leading integrated energy company.

The Role

Prerequisites? Must love data, insights and using these to drive and shape the customer journey! You will live for and love the experience our customers and audiences have when they visit www.originenergy.com.au and be the constant champion of our customers through this channel every single day. Other than that, you will lead and drive digital insights capability and strive for out of the box initiatives to improve it.

Sitting within our growing Digital team, your typical day to day will involve:
  • Leading the discovery of insights which will help inform the Service team's pipeline of work, assessing and prioritising initiatives
  • Working closely with our Optimisation team to support our testing and personalisation program
  • Fostering relationships across Origin to support end-to-end customer insights and ensuring visibility and understanding of digital sales performance

Is This You?

If nothing excites you more than using Adobe's full product stack and utilising data to enhance the customer experience, then we'd love to hear from you! You will be passionate about technology and highly experienced in delivering exceptional customer experiences across digital channels.

You will ideally have worked in a leadership / people manager capacity before and hold qualifications in a marketing, business or IT related discipline.

You're Experienced In
  • Working in digital analytics, using Adobe Analytics
  • Providing in-depth insights into online user experience and user journeys
  • Communicating and explaining complex insights to non-digital stakeholders


We embrace the diversity of our people and flexible working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the communities that we serve.
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

828957005:
[

Project Manager Contract

Company Name Isobar Company Location South Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 167 views

Job description

About Isobar


Isobar is a agency designed to help companies transform their businesses for the digital world. With more than 6,500 people and [1] 85 [2] offices across 45 markets, our capabilities span enablement and business model strategy, new product and service innovation,customer experience, omni-channel marketing and digital operations.

Isobar enables and encourages a culture of continuous learning, providing our people with new experiences and opportunities. Everyone who works at Isobar has access to Isobar Academy, our own learning platform, with content curated by our skill experts across markets and disciplines. This creates highly relevant and timely learning opportunities for our people around the world.

If you thrive on the belief that it’s our responsibility to usher our clients into what is next, then we want you.


Position Details:

Position: Project Manager
Department: Delivery
Reports directly to: Client Engagement Director


Position Overview


Isobar is looking for a rock solid Project Manager, brimming with enthusiasm for digital projects and the craft of delivery, to join its group of practitioners in delivering top-notch work for some of the best clients in the Southern Hemisphere.

As an advocate of efficient delivery processes, you’ll bring an innate understanding of how to manage projects effectively, making our teams and clients smile with your simple solutions, clear communication and buttoned-up documentation that steers projects through the murky waters of uncertainty towards success.

You’ll spend your days sitting alongside developers and designers, facilitating and enabling cross-functional teams to focus on understanding client problems and collectively building solutions. You will be an expert at predicting the future - foreseeing potential risks, then mitigating and contingency planning to ensure the best possible outcome.


About The Work


Delivering solutions to one of Australia’s biggest automotive brands, you’ll be part of a cross-functional team of problem-solvers and creative thinkers who put people at the centre of their work.

Creativity, experimentation and lateral thinking are as integral as delivering efficiently and successfully. You’ll work across multiple projects simultaneously and co-ordinate with other project managers within the team to deliver the holistic program-of-work.

As the facilitator of this team, you’ll bring structure and process that gives all of our crafts the room to bring out their best, whilst filling our clients with confidence in our direction and project success.


About You


You’ll be an advocate for the craft of delivery and Agile ways-of-working, believing in the benefit of applying the values and principles to any aspect of your professional career.

You are a warm and clear communicator of project health, forever using insight gleaned from the present to predict potential risks, issues and dependencies for the future.

Taking proactive actions to mitigate problems is second-nature to you, as is the need to produce purposeful documentation that can be used by clients and teams to fulfil their roles.


Key Responsibilities


● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 The delivery of projects through the facilitation and enablement of cross-functional teams

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Planning, estimating and scoping projects for success

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Monitoring budget, providing options when necessary to ensure commercial success

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Resource planning and management, identifying and escalating potential problems in advance

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Risk identification, mitigation and resolution across all projects

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Be the key point-of-contact for client queries on the delivery of their projects

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Follows delivery frameworks that provide a structured, transparent and collaborative approach to delivering great work.

\xa0

Desired Skills & Experience


● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 3+ years’ experience working in a Delivery role within a digital environment

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Live examples of projects with budgets $200k to $400k in range

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Demonstrable experience running multiple projects successfully and simultaneously

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Proficient using Jira, Confluence, Excel and MS Project

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Proactive and experienced in project scoping, risk mitigation and contingency planning

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Multifaceted delivery practitioner combining both traditional PM skills and Agile values

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Clear communication and client-facing skills

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Comprehension and application of Agile values and principles

● \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Emotional intelligence and empathic understanding of teams and clients

\xa0

Interested?
\xa0
Great, just send us your CV, portfolio and a covering letter that highlights why you think you are suitable and anything else that you think we would find interesting – and if we think we would like working together then we will give you a call.

“At DAN, a diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work, and be proud of doing so. For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.”
